review: This is a very simple but effective device that does exactly what it says it does.  It's features are minimal however the price is so low that it's hard to find fault with this device.  I bought two and have both of them powered off built in USB ports which is great since if I had to connect this to an outlet I'd have reduced the star rating by at least one.  Rumors are that more services will be added beyond the current Youtube, Google Play and Chrome browser and this will make this even more useful.
author: Paul H

review: Had my Chromecast for a couple of weeks now and really don't know why you wouldn't want one. Netflix, Hulu+, more coming and just about anything from your desktop or laptop, Even my wife who is not into tech has grown to love it watching several shows and movies. Would love to see Amazon Prime sorted out better but even using Googlecast from the browser is very workable. For $35 what's not to like.Raymond

review: The idea is awesome. However it only works for some applications.1. I bought the device thinking my tv will simply mimic what is on my computer or ipad. but it only streams from certain apps.3.  Sound is an issue when I attempt the web browser casting. I thought this would be a way around only having certain applications that worked with the device. It does display my computer screen, but no sound is transmitted.With that said I hope there is more versatility with different applications in the future. That would make my rating go up. For now im better off using my hdmi cable to plug in my laptop

review: So i got this since my computer is in my living room and my friends and I enjoy sharing youtube videos we find with each other. However i found out my 42" HDTV (which is only 3 years old) is NOT HDCP compatible. I wont go into detail about the evil that is "HDCP" ill let you google/bing that and find out. but basicly most tv's made outside of 2010 are most likely not HDCP compatible which means this will not work. you will get a black screen, no sound, nothing.However lucky for me i have spare tv's in other bedrooms which ARE hdcp compliant; and this works fine on them. playing video on your computer/in your browser and 'casting' it to your tv however is laggy. skippy. jumpy. casting from your phone or mobile device is flawless and works just fine.if it wasnt for this new compliance bull crap this would be amazing on any tv; but make sure your tv is HDCP complaint first.
